channel.title: Matlab examples - the blog...
channel.description: In this blog I propose some interesting Matlab exercises, examples and tutorials to cover powerful programming instructions to work with matrices, vectors and arrays.

item.title: Create Matlab GUI - video
item.description: Video demonstration of how a Matlab GUI is created, drag-and-drop capabilities, and callback functions introduction...

item.title: Power Factor Correction Capacitors
item.description: Example of the formulas to calculate power factor correction capacitors. These diagrams show the relationship of...

item.title: Card Trick with Matlab GUI
item.description: In this article we’re going to develop another computerized card trick using callback-functions in Matlab GUIs. I strongly suggest you read the first and second articles in this series, to know how to start and how to use the very important three instructions ‘get’, ‘set’ and ‘guidata’...

item.title: WinSpice Simulator and Matlab
item.description: WinSpice Simulator driven from Matlab. In this article, a Matlab routine to drive the WinSPICE simulator is presented. This method can be easily adapted to simulate any circuit entered in a fully parameterized manner. The performance of the Matlab driver is illustrated by simulating a simple amplifier...

item.title: Line detection - working images with Matlab...
item.description: This experiment explores line detection (image analysis) with Matlab...

item.title: Fourier Analysis - introduction from a practical point of view
item.description: Fourier analysis has many applications in science, physics, digital signal processing, imaging, numerical analysis, acoustics... Let's use math software to...

item.title: 3D Plot Part 2 - working with Matlab
item.description: The 3D plot functions intended for plotting meshes and surfaces 'mesh' and 'surf', and their several variants 'meshc', 'meshz', 'surfc', and 'surfl', take multiple optional input arguments, the most simple form being 'mesh(z)' or 'surf(z)', where z represents a matrix. See these examples...

item.title: Polynomials in Matlab
item.description: Polynomials are used so commonly in algebra, geometry and math in general that Matlab has special commands to deal with them. The polynomial 2x4 + 3x3 − 10x2 − 11x + 22 is represented in Matlab by the array [2, 3, -10, -11, 22] (coefficients...

item.title: Polynomial Regression in Matlab - easy least squares fitting
item.description: We'll demonstrate how to work out polynomial regression in Matlab (also known as polynomial least squares fittings)...

item.title: Periodic Function - some codes without special toolboxes in Matlab
item.description: A periodic function repeats its values in regular periods or intervals. We explore codes for square and sawtooth waves without any special toolbox needed...

item.title: Calculating BMI - another GUI in Matlab
item.description: In this project, we are going to develop a GUI in Matlab to calculate the BMI (body mass index). We are going to introduce the radio button...

item.title: Numerical Gradient - code in Matlab
item.description: We are going to include the concepts in our Derivative function created before, to develop a Matlab function to calculate the gradient of a multidimensional scalar function. The function is going to have the following functionality...

item.title: Polygon Area - calculate with Matlab
item.description: This program calculates a polygon area, using Matlab. You must supply the x and y coordinates of all vertices. Coordinates must be entered in order of successive vertices...

item.title: T statistic - Student's t-distribution Test in Matlab
item.description: This algorithm performs the t statistic and degrees of freedom for Student’s distribution, in Matlab code. The calculations can be based on any one of these three hypotheses...

item.title: Permutations and Combinations - calculate its number in Matlab
item.description: This algorithm (code in Matlab) calculates the number of permutations and combinations of N objects taken D at a time. The full Matlab code is...

item.title: Callback Function - GUIs in Matlab
item.description: In this article we’re going to build-up a simple adder. Our adder (by means of relevant callback function s) is going to have two ‘edit text’ components, two ‘static text’ components, and one ‘push button’ element.

item.title: Matlab Plot - using stems (vertical lines) for discrete functions
item.description: In this example, we study the Matlab plot 'stem' instruction to illustrate functions. It draws vertical lines (with little circles on the tip) proportional to the value of the function at that horizontal value...

item.description: The Smith chart is a graphical tool designed for engineers specializing in RF to solve problems related to transmission lines and matching circuits....

item.title: Recursion - a conceptual example in Matlab
item.description: Recursion is a kind of tricky and smart construction which allows a function to call itself. The Matlab programming language supports it...

item.description: How a nodal analysis can let you find voltages in an electrical circuit. Use this math software to work out the arithmetic operations...

item.description: We’ll work with exponential regression in a curve fitting in Matlab. The following three methods find the coefficients of an equation for an exp. curve...

item.title: Scilab Commands and Types
item.description: Basic Scilab commands and data types are introduced with basic examples, see these descriptions...

item.description: This Half-life calculator is used to know the period of time it takes for a substance undergoing decay to decrease by half...

item.title: Horizontal Lines - plotting in Matlab
item.description: We show you how to draw horizontal lines (and vertical lines) in Matlab, and add them to any given plot...

item.title: Binary to decimal numbers - Four ways to convert them in Matlab
item.description: We present four variations of a binary to decimal conversion in Matlab; that is, we're going to convert binary numbers (numbers with only symbols '0' and '1') to decimal numbers (numbers with 10 different symbols, from '0' to '9')...

item.title: Matlab GUI - First steps...
item.description: We are going to develop a simple Matlab GUI. We’ll use the Matlab GUIDE (Graphical User Interface Development Environment) which is pretty handy... This article is a super-fast introduction, but very convenient because with some ingenuity you can learn it in 10 minutes... or so...

item.description: Polar plots use magnitudes and angles. In this article we’ll show the Matlab built-in commands 'compass', 'polar' and 'rose'...

item.description: To convert from binary to hexadecimal numbers, we first need to know what a hexadecimal number is. A major numbering method in digital systems is the hexadecimal system...

item.title: Matrix Multiplication - step-by-step
item.description: In this example, we show a code in Matlab that performs a matrix multiplication step-by-step. The algorithm displays all the elements being considered for the multiplication and shows how the resulting matrix is being formed in each step...

item.title: Matrix Inversion in Matlab - Gauss-Jordan method
item.description: This program performs the matrix inversion of a square matrix step-by-step. The inversion is performed by a modified Gauss-Jordan elimination method. We start with an arbitrary square matrix and a same-size identity matrix ...

item.title: Factorials - ways to code them without special functions
item.description: Factorials of positive integers are the product of all positive integers less than or equal to n. Operations are denoted by n!...

item.description: Three-dimensional plots ( or 3D graphs ) can be created by Matlab. It provides lots of facilities for visualization of 3D information or data...

item.title: Armstrong Numbers - a code in Matlab
item.description: Armstrong numbers of three digits are integers such that the sum of the cubes of its digits equals the number itself. For example, 153 is an Armstrong number since 1^3 + 5^3 + 3^3 = 153...

item.title: Quadratic Equations - solve them with this simple code
item.description: We're creating now a Matlab program that calculates the quadratic roots (of quadratic equations ). The equation must be in the following form: ax2 + bx + c = 0, where a, b, and c are real coefficients...

item.title: Interpolation - easy code with Matlab
item.description: This code calculates the y-coordinates of points on a line given their x-coordinates ( interpolation ). It is necessary to know coordinates of two points on the same line. The point is interpolated using the following formula...
